channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid-19: NI ministers agree to relax self-isolation rules
item.description: New measures to be put in place for fully-vaccinated people who are a close contact of a Covid case.

item.title: GCSEs: Rise in top grades in Northern Ireland as results issued
item.description: Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, pupils' results were based on grades calculated by schools.

item.title: What are Northern Ireland's Covid-19 rules now?
item.description: How do restrictions here compare to other parts of the UK and the Republic of Ireland?

item.title: PSNI investigates attacks on homes in Belfast and Coleraine
item.description: Shots were fired at a house and up to nine men targeted a house in north Belfast in separate incidents.

item.title: Limerick: Pair arrested on suspicion of child's murder
item.description: The four-year-old child was fatally injured in a house in Limerick on 13 March.

item.title: Former B&M worker settles disability discrimination case
item.description: Harvey Spence, who has a learning disability, says he "dreaded going to work" because of his experience.

item.title: The Northern Ireland couple who took on the world in a camper van
item.description: In 1971, a couple left the violence in Belfast to travel around the world in a camper van.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: The lowdown on the exams in NI
item.description: A potted guide to GCSE exams, which did not take place for the second year in a row due to Covid-19.

item.title: Northern Ireland blood donation rule changes to be implemented
item.description: Men in a same-sex relationship for more than three months will now be able to donate blood.

item.title: Covid-19: Vaccine portal for 12 to 15-year-olds in Ireland opens
item.description: Children will need consent from a parent or guardian when registering or at the vaccination centre.

item.title: Timmy the Tunneller to begin Belfast flood alleviation work
item.description: A primary seven pupil at Downey House Primary School won a competition to name the machine.

item.title: Armstrong says Windsor Park is set for big future
item.description: Gerry Armstrong expects Windsor Park's successful staging of the Uefa Super Cup will mean other big football occasions coming to the venue.

item.title: Covid-19: NI student struggling to get vaccination certificate
item.description: Conor Kernohan cannot get a vaccine certificate as he got one jab in GB and the second in Belfast.

item.title: Covid-19: Education minister wants end to masks in class
item.description: The Northern Ireland Executive is expected to discuss face coverings and class bubbles on Thursday.

item.title: No away fans allowed at September's European internationals because of 'spike' in Covid cases
item.description: No away fans will be permitted at next month's international matches in Europe because of a "spike"in Covid-19 cases, Uefa and Fifa confirm.

item.title: Covid-19: Three more deaths and 1,467 new coronavirus cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,233.

item.title: Covid-19: Unvaccinated dad speaks of four-day ventilator ordeal
item.description: Gerald Prentice, who spent four days on a ventilator, says he has "no doubt" a jab would have helped.

item.title: Anger at overflowing Covid test drop boxes
item.description: Provider Randox says it is increasing collections but the tests for UK arrivals are branded "pointless".

item.title: Covid-19: Vaccination 'dramatically' reduces hospital cases
item.description: NI's chief scientific officer made the comments as one hospital trust cancelled outpatient clinics.

item.title: Uefa Super Cup final in Belfast: In pictures
item.description: Chelsea will take on Villareal at Windsor Park in the first Uefa club final held in Belfast.

item.title: Eniola Aluko: Ex-footballer calls for end to online abuse
item.description: Former England footballer Eniola Aluko deleted her Twitter account after receiving racist abuse.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Uefa Super Cup: Irish FA chief Nelson says Chelsea-Villarreal game 'fantastic opportunity' for Northern Ireland
item.description: Irish FA chief Patrick Nelson says Wednesday's Uefa Super Cup between Chelsea and Villarreal will be a "great advert" for Northern Ireland.

item.title: Q&A: A-level results day in Northern Ireland
item.description: The lowdown on A-levels in Northern Ireland as pupils receive their results on Tuesday.

item.title: Uefa Super Cup: Fans arrive in Belfast ahead of Chelsea vs. Villareal game
item.description: Football fans have been arriving in Belafst ahead of Wednesday's Uefa Super Cup Final at Windsor Park.

item.title: Nurse resignations: 'I was there for four years and was exhausted'
item.description: A total of 315 nurses left the Belfast Trust in the first half of this year and more than half resigned.

item.title: Kellie Harrington: Dublin boxer celebrates victory in her home city.
item.description: Boxer Kellie Harrington paraded through Dublin on an open-top bus as crowds of supporters celebrated her Olympic victory.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Had I had a vaccine, would it have helped? 100%'
item.description: Gerald Prentice, who spent four days on a ventilator, says he has "no doubt" a jab would have helped.

item.title: Covid-19: Derry man out on bail after refusing hotel quarantine
item.description: The 32-year-old faces a fine of up to £10,000 if convicted of breaching Covid-19 rules

item.title: Apprentice Boys Relief of Derry parade scaled back for second year
item.description: The annual parade marks the anniversary of the ending of the Siege of Derry in August 1689.

item.title: Londonderry: Elemental Software bought for undisclosed sum
item.description: The software firm was set up by former community development workers and employs more than 30 people.

item.title: Derry City: Councillors press for Brandywell funding date
item.description: The first phase of the Ryan McBride Brandywell Stadium redevelopment was completed in 2018.

item.title: Kathy Hochul: New York's next governor influenced by Irish roots
item.description: Kathy Hochul's grandparents were from Ireland and had a "profound impact" on her political outlook.

item.title: Covid-19: Vaccines for Irish 12 to 15-year-olds start this weekend
item.description: Health chiefs expect a strong uptake when registrations for the age group open on Thursday.

item.title: Irish Boxer Harrington wins Olympic gold
item.description: Irish boxer Kellie Harrington wins an Olympic gold medal after defeating Brazil's Beatriz Ferreira in the women's lightweight final.

item.title: Rosslare Port: Heroin worth more than €12m seized
item.description: Revenue says investigations are ongoing following the seizure of the drugs.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ireland allows up to 200 to gather at outdoor events
item.description: Customers will also be able to book multiple tables in outdoor hospitality venues.
